snippet: The cease-fire between the Ukrainian government and Russian-backed separatists held on Saturday, but some violations were reported, and soldiers and civilians doubted that calm would prevail.
abstract: Cease-fire between Ukrainian government and Russian-backed separatists is shaken as violations are reported around southern Ukrainian city of Mariupol; details of shelling remain unclear.

byline.original: By CARLOTTA GALL and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Carlotta Gall reported from Lebedinskoye, and Neil MacFarquhar from Kiev, Ukraine. Alexandra Odynova contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The cease-fire between the Ukrainian government and Russian-backed separatists held on Saturday, but some violations were reported, and soldiers and civilians doubted that calm would prevail.

headline.main: Cease-Fire in Ukraine Holds, but Soldiers and Residents Doubt It Will Last
headline.print_headline: Cease-Fire in Ukraine Is Shaken as Violations Are Reported in Southeast
